intro: Ipomopsis bridgesii, commonly known as the bridges' touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Ipomopsis bridgesii is known for its ecological importance as a nectar source for various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
